keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to manage his condition.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor, which developed accidentally on Instagram.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with insulin.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of the condition.
Advancements in diabetes monitoring technology have improved his daily management and quality of life.
Stress from his high-profile career and parenting his four-year-old twins contributes to blood sugar fluctuations.
There is currently no official announcement about an *NSYNC reunion or tour.
Lance Bass has stated that recent articles about a possible reunion are inaccurate and based on misinformation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the pop band *NSYNC, addresses fan speculation about a possible reunion tour, stating there is no current plan. Instead, he emphasizes his experience living with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), sharing insights on how he manages his condition using the Dexcom G7 glucose monitor. He created the online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate and entertain audiences about diabetes, particularly highlighting how foods like white rice and white bread cause dangerous blood sugar spikes. His family life, including parenting his twins Violet and Alexander with husband Michael Turchin, adds stress, which also impacts his blood sugar. He credits advancements in technology and peer support within the diabetic community for improving his quality of life, while dismissing rumors of a reunion as inaccurate and misleading.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
